savedialog.py¶

This appears to be a module-level docstring, providing an overview of the module.

class src.view.savedialog.savedialog.SaveDialog(callback: Callable[[Path], None], **kwargs)¶

SaveDialog is a class that extends the Popup class from Kivy. It is used for creating a dialog box to save files.

Parameters:

  • callback (collections.abc.Callable) – A callable function that accepts a Path object and returns None.

  • kwargs – Additional keyword arguments to be passed to the Popup constructor.

cancel()¶

This method is called when the cancel button in the dialog is clicked. It dismisses the dialog.

Return type:

None

property path¶

return:

save()¶

This method is called when the save button in the dialog is clicked. It constructs a Path object from the specified path and filename, checks if the parent directory exists, and then invokes the callback function before dismissing the dialog.

Return type:

None
